briefdescription.para: Resource does not need history, requesting it will result in an error message.

detaileddescription.para: History is required and should be an all-zero image on the first frame. This might be slow, so should only be used when necessary. NOTE: for CPU-resources, this simply default-constructs them

History is required and it doesn't matter what it contains on the first frame This is the preferred variant as it is faster, but it might cause artifacts and trash value propagation for cumulative type algorithms. NOTE: for CPU-resources, this simply default-constructs them

briefdescription.para: History policy for a resource. Must always be specified on creation.
Node has an empty execution callback that can safely be skipped.
Default: node only accesses daFG state and may be culled away.
Node has side effects outside daFG and will never be culled away.
Specified the side effects of executing a node.

detaileddescription.para: For legacy code only. Will suppress a barrier before this usage and force a barrier after this usage.
All pre-rasterization stages: indirect draw reading, vertex input, vertex shader, geometry shader, tesselation shaders, mesh shaders.
All post-rasterization stages: early tests, fragment shader, late tests, attachment output.

briefdescription.para: Copute dispatches.
Blit and copy operations.
All raytrace shaders.

detaileddescription.para: Aliases for simple use-cases. Note however that even though all PS usages are POST_RASTER, but not all POST_RASTER usages are from the pixel shader (PS). Use with caution so as not to confuse the reader of your code.

briefdescription.para: Anything graphics-related.
Reads from inderection buffers can only happen during one of these stages.
Describes a GPU pipeline stage at which a resource is accessed. Part of the information required for daFG to place barriers. Note that this is a flags enum, so you can combine multiple stages.

detaileddescription.para: For legacy code only, will suppress a barrier before this usage and force a barrier after this usage.

briefdescription.para: Regular render target.
Depth buffer.
Vulkan only: automatic MSAA resolve inside a subpass.

detaileddescription.para: Any type of shader resource, i.e. a sampled image or a storage buffer/texture in terms of vulkan and an SRV or a UAV in terms of directX.
Special type of shader resource that is limited in size but is faster to read. Marked as cbuffer in shaders.

briefdescription.para: Index buffer for a draw primitive.
Vertex buffer for a draw primitive.
Either the source or the destination of a copy operation.
Either the source or the destination of a blit operation.
A buffer used for an indirect draw/dispatch/raytrace primitive.
A texture used for determining variable shading rate for regions.
Vulkan only: subpass input attachment.

detaileddescription.para: A special read-only usage type that allows a texture to be used as a read-only depth target as well as a sampled image simultaneously.

briefdescription.para: Describes the way a node uses a resource. Part of the information required for daFG to place barriers.
A concrete physical resource provided to daFG for external virtual resource on a particular multiplexing iteration.

memberdef.definition: using dafg::ExternalResourceProvider = typedef dag::FixedMoveOnlyFunction<32, ExternalResource(const multiplexing::Index &) const>
memberdef.name: ExternalResourceProvider

briefdescription.para: A callback that provides a physical resource to daFG for a particular external virtual resource on a particular multiplexing iteration. Note that if a node that registers this virtual resource is multiplexed along any dimension, this callback will be called multiple times and must return different values each time.
Type for daFG node execution priorities.
Default priority that is used when none is specified explicitly.
Max priority: the node will be executed as late as possible.
Min priority: the node will be executed as early as possible.
Special value for Texture2dCreateInfo::mipLevels. daFG will automatically generate all mip levels for such a texture.
Opens frame graph visualization window.
Request a node to render full screen postFx with a shader.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the shader to use.
